comment: There's a lot of work for the class. Many connect assignments, which is part of the class. Group projects. Two tests that are open note. He's a fair guy and will extend due dates when necessary. Great professor!

Professor Cutts is super interactive with his students and cares about you passing and making sure you have what you need. he's new to KSU so be patient but his delivery in lecture is good its mostly discussion which is super chill and open to any comments. I would def take him just show up to class and put in the work and you'll be fine.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Get ready to read

comment: Professor Cutts is a wonderful instructor. He has humor, is transparent, and gives plenty of time to complete work. His lectures keep you interested and are very clear. On top of that, he is laid back and wants to ensure everyone has a fair chance to earn a good grade. 10/10 Would absolutely take again.

This is the worst professor/teacher I have ever taken in my entire life! He has NO respect for his students and will cancel class last minute, and then threaten anyone who doesn't show up to class (even for 1 day) to fail them. He also accuses people of plagiarism who clearly did their own work. He's just aweful.

This guy started out chill. However around midway through the semester he switched up. Had a power trip and gave everyone who didnt show up on a certain day a 0 on a case study. Cancels classes all the time but throws a fit if you miss a single class. Bad professor, but very easy class as long as you adhere to his ever changing standards
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Group projects

comment: Unorganized professor. D2L is a mess and doesn't give clear standards for assignments, yet says he does. He's openly rude to students in class that ask questions that maybe they missed, and I was scared constantly throughout the semester to ask questions when I didn't understand something. Easy class with large project at the end. Avoid this guy.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Group projects

comment: He is extremely understanding and very straightforward about his intentions for the course. He just wants to see you try. If you show up and participate, you will pass. He asks the students that show up when they want to set the due dates, so that is why people claim to not know when things are due (they did not show up).
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Group projects--Clear grading criteria

comment: Extremely unorganized, used materials from other IS professors as his own. Changed many assignments and due dates without letting students know. Will literally respond to emails to tell you to message him on teams. Only positive is that he gave a 100 on almost every grade.
